\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 97303}

\subsection*{Down Like a Treat}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{benzolover}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 6 mg & oral & Etizolam & \\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 77.00 kg\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
Because of a recent drought, decided to try a new one that was `legal' etizolam. All I managed to read off the computer is that it is extremely similar to vallium with two major differences: a) not so much drousy and bumbling about as most do, b) much more smiley and talkative while still being in a very relaxed state, a happy middle if you will. 



This was a pleasant change from my usual plastered to a sofa with a walk like the floor hand elastic sticky glue. Overall it seemed to be a much nicer version of said drug along with being legal if a little trickly to obtain. 



P.s sorry there is not and blow by blow it is due to the slight social setting which I was in.

\end{document}
